FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: study

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample

FIELD.LABEL: Age Class
FIELD.NAME: AgeClass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The age class of the organism at the time of collection.

FIELD.LABEL: broad_scale_environmental_context
FIELD.NAME: broad_scale_environmental_context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvOâ€™s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local_scale_environmental_context
FIELD.NAME: local_scale_environmental_context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD.LABEL: environmental_medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental_medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: dissociation

FIELD.LABEL: enrichment_markers
FIELD.NAME: enrichment_markers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the specificity markers used to isolate cell populations e.g. 'CD45+'

FIELD.LABEL: isolation_kit
FIELD.NAME: isolation_kit
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The kit used to isolate the cells.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: cell_suspension

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: library_preparation

FIELD.LABEL: library_construction_method
FIELD.NAME: library_construction_method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The library construction method (including version) that was used, e.g. "Smart-Seq2", "Drop-Seq", "10X v3".

FIELD.LABEL: input_molecule
FIELD.NAME: input_molecule
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The specific fraction of biological macromolecule from which the sequencing library is derived, e.g. "polyA RNA".

FIELD.LABEL: amplification_method
FIELD.NAME: amplification_method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method used to amplify the cDNA, e.g. "PCR".

FIELD.LABEL: library_construction_method
FIELD.NAME: library_construction_method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The library construction method (including version) that was used, e.g. "Smart-Seq2", "Drop-Seq", "10X v3".

FIELD.LABEL: input_molecule
FIELD.NAME: input_molecule
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The specific fraction of biological macromolecule from which the sequencing library is derived, e.g. "polyA RNA".

FIELD.LABEL: primer
FIELD.NAME: primer
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. "oligo-dT" or "random" primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input, e.g. enriched for mRNA.

FIELD.LABEL: end_bias
FIELD.NAME: end_bias
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The end bias of the library, e.g. "5'" or "3'".

FIELD.LABEL: library_strand
FIELD.NAME: library_strand
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The strand from which the library was derived, e.g. "unstranded", "sense", "antisense".

FIELD.LABEL: spike_in
FIELD.NAME: spike_in
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Spike-in RNAs are RNA molecules with known sequence that are added to the cell lysis mix. E.g. the External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) spike in set is commonly used in scRNA-seq experiments.

FIELD.LABEL: spike_in_dilution_or_concentration
FIELD.NAME: spike_in_dilution_or_concentration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The final concentration or dilution (for commercial sets) of the spike in mix, e.g. "1:40,000"

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sequencing

FIELD.LABEL: technical_replicate_group_or_library_reference
FIELD.NAME: technical_replicate_group_or_library_reference
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A common term for all runs/files belonging to the same cell or library. We suggest to use a stable sample accession from a biosample archive like BioSamples database6. Alternatively, the library ID can be referenced from which the files were generated.

FIELD.LABEL: technical_replicate_group_or_library_reference
FIELD.NAME: technical_replicate_group_or_library_reference
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A common term for all runs/files belonging to the same cell or library. We suggest to use a stable sample accession from a biosample archive like BioSamples database6. Alternatively, the library ID can be referenced from which the files were generated.

FIELD.LABEL: UMI_barcode_read
FIELD.NAME: UMI_barcode_read
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of read that contains the UMI barcode: index1/index2/read1/read2.

FIELD.LABEL: UMI_barcode_offset
FIELD.NAME: UMI_barcode_offset
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The offset in sequence of the UMI identifying barcode. E.g. "16"

FIELD.LABEL: UMI_barcode_size
FIELD.NAME: UMI_barcode_size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The size of the UMI identifying barcode. E.g. "10".

FIELD.LABEL: cell_barcode_read
FIELD.NAME: cell_barcode_read
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of read that contains the UMI barcode: index1/index2/read1/read2.

FIELD.LABEL: cell_barcode_offset
FIELD.NAME: cell_barcode_offset
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode. E.g. "0".

FIELD.LABEL: cell_barcode_size
FIELD.NAME: cell_barcode_size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode. E.g. "0".

FIELD.LABEL: cDNA_read
FIELD.NAME: cDNA_read
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of read that contains the cDNA read: index1/index2/read1/read2.

FIELD.LABEL: cDNA_read_offset
FIELD.NAME: cDNA_read_offset
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of read that contains the cDNA read: index1/index2/read1/read2.

FIELD.LABEL: cDNA_read_offset
FIELD.NAME: cDNA_read_offset
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of read that contains the cDNA read: index1/index2/read1/read2.

FIELD.LABEL: cDNA_read_size
FIELD.NAME: cDNA_read_size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The size of the cDNA read. E.g. "100".

FIELD.LABEL: sample_barcode_read
FIELD.NAME: sample_barcode_read
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of read that contains the sample barcode: index1/index2/read1/read2

FIELD.LABEL: sample_barcode_offset
FIELD.NAME: sample_barcode_offset
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The offset in sequence of the sample identifying barcode. E.g. "0".

FIELD.LABEL: sample_barcode_size
FIELD.NAME: sample_barcode_size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of read that contains the sample barcode: index1/index2/read1/read2

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: file

FIELD.LABEL: library_preparation_reference
FIELD.NAME: library_preparation_reference
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file that contains the library preparation information. E.g. "File1_LibraryPrep.json".

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing_reference
FIELD.NAME: sequencing_reference
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file that contains the sequencing information. E.g. "File1_Sequencing.json".

FIELD.LABEL: read_1_file
FIELD.NAME: read_1_file
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file that contains read 1. E.g. "File1_R1.fastq.gz".

FIELD.LABEL: read_2_file
FIELD.NAME: read_2_file
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file that contains read 2. E.g. "File1_R2.fastq.gz".

FIELD.LABEL: index_1_file
FIELD.NAME: index_1_file
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file that contains index read 1. E.g. "File1_I1.fastq.gz".

FIELD.LABEL: index_2_file
FIELD.NAME: index_2_file
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file that contains index read 1. E.g. "File1_I2.fastq.gz".

FIELD.LABEL: checksum
FIELD.NAME: checksum
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Result of a hash function calculated on the file content to assert file integrity. Commonly used algorithms are MD5 and SHA-1. E.g. "ab21a9c0f2007890fe2fbe48df0519f9".

FIELD.LABEL: white_list_barcode_file
FIELD.NAME: white_list_barcode_file
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A file containing the known cell barcodes in the dataset.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: analysis_derived_data

FIELD.LABEL: file_derived_from
FIELD.NAME: file_derived_from
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file that was used to generate the analysis derived data. E.g. "File1_Sequencing.json".

FIELD.LABEL: inferred_cell_type
FIELD.NAME: inferred_cell_type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Post analysis cell type or identity declaration based on expression profile or known gene function identified by the performer, e.g. if a pool of cells are sequenced with the purpose of identifying new cell types or sub- populations. Per cell, in addition to sample of origin metadata, lineage, class, and subclass attributes that serve to group cells within the sample or set of samples can be declared. E.g. "type II bipolar neuron".

FIELD.LABEL: post_analysis_cell_well_quality
FIELD.NAME: post_analysis_cell_well_quality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Performer defined measure of whether the read output from the cell was included in the sequencing analysis. For example, cells might be excluded if a threshold percentage of reads did not map to the genome or if pre-sequencing quality measures were not passed. E.g. "pass" or "fail".

FIELD.LABEL: other_derived_cell_attributes
FIELD.NAME: other_derived_cell_attributes
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any other cell level measurement or annotation as result of the analysis. E.g. cluster, gene count, UMI count, tSNE coordinates.
